name: paper-tabs
description:
`paper-tabs` is a `core-selector` styled to look like tabs. Tabs make it easy to explore and switch between different views or functional aspects of an app, or to browse categorized data sets. Use `selected` property to get or set the selected tab. Example: TAB 1 TAB 2 TAB 3 See paper-tab for more information about `paper-tab`. A common usage for `paper-tabs` is to use it along with `core-pages` to switch between different views. Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 3
Page 1
Page 2
Page 3
 `paper-tabs` adapt to mobile/narrow layout when there is a `core-narrow` class set on itself or any of its ancestors. To use links in tabs, add `link` attribute to `paper-tabs` and put an `` element in `paper-tab`. Example: TAB ONE TAB TWO TAB THREE Styling tabs: To change the sliding bar color: paper-tabs.pink::shadow #selectionBar { background-color: #ff4081; } To change the ink ripple color: paper-tabs.pink paper-tab::shadow #ink { color: #ff4081; }

attributes.name: noink
attributes.description: If true, ink ripple effect is disabled.

attributes.name: nobar
attributes.description: If true, the bottom bar to indicate the selected tab will not be shown.

attributes.name: noslide
attributes.description: If true, the slide effect for the bottom bar is disabled.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description: If true, tabs are scrollable and the tab width is based on the label width.

attributes.name: disableDrag
attributes.description: If true, dragging on the tabs to scroll is disabled.

attributes.name: hideScrollButton
attributes.description: If true, scroll buttons (left/right arrow) will be hidden for scrollable tabs.

methods.name: updateBar
methods.description:
Invoke this to update the size and position of the bottom bar.  Usually
you only need to call this if the `paper-tabs` is initially hidden and
later becomes visible.

methods.name: selectPrevious
methods.description:
Selects the previous item. This should be used in single selection only.

                 wrap to the end

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the first item,

methods.name: selectNext
methods.description:
Selects the next item.  This should be used in single selection only.

                 wrap to the front

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the last item,
